title: Inferential Statistics
text:
Inferential statistics let us make conclusions about a population based on sample data. This includes concepts like probability, sampling distribution, confidence intervals, and hypothesis testing.




Answer all 5 quiz questions.
At least 3 correct to pass.





 A. Describe the entire population  B. Predict future crime trends  C. Make generalizations about a population using sample data




 A. Probability null is true  B. Probability of observing your result (or more extreme) if null is true  C. Confidence in sample mean




 A. 95% of data fall in this range  B. 95% confident the population value lies within  C. The interval includes all variation




 A. Sampling distributions approach normality as n increases  B. All sample means are equal  C. Larger samples are skewed




 A. Chi-square test  B. t-test  C. ANOVA
 Submit Answers

title: Descriptive Statistics
text:
Descriptive statistics summarize data so it can be easily understood. In criminology, they are used to describe crime trends, offender characteristics, and patterns in victimization. Core concepts include frequency distributions, measures of central tendency (mean, median, mode), dispersion (variance, standard deviation), and visualization techniques like histograms and boxplots.




Answer all 10 questions.
Youâ€™ll get instant feedback.
At the end, your score will be shown.
You need at least 50% to proceed to the next topic.





 A. Predict future outcomes  B. Summarize and describe data  C. Establish causal relationships




 A. Range  B. Standard deviation  C. Median




 A. The average value  B. The spread of values  C. The middle value




 A. Nominal  B. Interval  C. Ratio




 A. Gender  B. Age  C. Eye color




 A. Skewed left  B. Bell curve  C. Flat




 A. Mean  B. Median  C. Mode




 A. One variable  B. The distribution of frequencies  C. The relationship between two variables




 A. Line chart  B. Bar chart  C. Boxplot




 A. A causal link  B. A non-existent or misleading correlation  C. A perfect relationship
 Submit Answers

title: Statistics Course for Students
text:
This interactive course is designed to help undergraduate students in social science and criminology understand basic statistical concepts using examples, quizzes, and visual explanations.
